Package ohos.media.image

Class Image.Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.image.Image.Component
  • Enclosing class:
    Image

    public static class Image.Component
extends Object
    Describes image color components.

    This class provides methods for obtaining image color component attributes, and reading and writing color component data.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Image.Component.OperationResult
      Describes results of color componentâ€“related operations.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      ImageFormat.ComponentType componentType
      Indicates the color component type defined in ImageFormat.ComponentType.
      int pixelStride
      Indicates the distance in bytes between adjacent pixels in a row.
      int rowStride
      Indicates the distance in bytes between adjacent pixel rows.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read​()
        Reads color component data of one byte.
        Returns:
        Returns the data if the reading is successful; returns OperationResult#FAILURE constant if the reading fails; returns the OperationResult#RELEASED constant if the image or component data is released.
        Since:
        1

      • read

        public int read​(byte[] dstArray)
        Reads color component data of multiple consecutive bytes.
        Parameters:
        dstArray - Indicates an array to store the data.
        Returns:
        Returns the OperationResult#SUCCESS constant if the reading is successful; returns the OperationResult#FAILURE constant if the reading fails; returns the OperationResult#RELEASED constant if the image or component data is released.
        Since:
        1

      • read

        public int read​(byte[] dstArray,
                int offset,
                int length)
        Reads color component data of multiple consecutive bytes and write the data in an array with specified offsets and length.
        Parameters:
        dstArray - Indicates an array to store the data.
        offset - Indicates where to write the data in the target array.
        length - Indicates the maximum length allowed to write data into the target array.
        Returns:
        Returns the OperationResult#SUCCESS constant if the reading is successful; returns the OperationResult#FAILURE constant if the reading fails; returns the OperationResult#RELEASED constant if the image or component data is released.
        Since:
        1

      • tell

        public int tell​()
        Obtains the position of the current color component data to read.
        Returns:
        Returns the position of the current color component data if obtained; returns the OperationResult#RELEASED if the image or component data is released.
        Since:
        1

      • seek

        public int seek​(int newPosition)
        Sets a position of the current color component data to read.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - Indicates a new position of the current color component data to read.
        Returns:
        Returns the OperationResult#SUCCESS constant if the reading position is set; returns the OperationResult#FAILURE constant if the setting fails; returns the OperationResult#RELEASED constant if the image or component data is released.
        Since:
        1

      • remaining

        public int remaining​()
        Obtains the remaining data size (in bytes) of the color component.
        Returns:
        Returns the bytes of the remaining data if obtained; returns the OperationResult#RELEASED if the image or component data is released.
        Since:
        1

      • getBuffer

        public ByteBuffer getBuffer​()
        Obtains the ByteBuffer object of the current color component. Note that the object directly maps to the native resource buffer. After the receiver or image resource is released, the object should not be used to read or write data.
        Returns:
        Returns the ByteBuffer object of the current color component.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the operation is not supported, for example, if native resources associated with the receiver or image are released.
        Since:
        1

      • release

        public void release​()
        Releases native resources associated with the color component.

        After this method is called, color component-related operations will no longer be supported.

        Since:
        1
